reviews.review: Fun to Play. Hard to Beat. Requires Thinking. Great game for everyone!

Una obra maestra, engancha desde que se comienza a jugar, la historia es muy original y atrapante además que brinda alguna que otra sorpresa conforme se va avanzando en el juego, los gráficos son buenos y el paso del tiempo y el deterioro de la instalaciones donde nos encontramos están muy bien logrados, la música suena para dar intriga y ésta logra su objetivo. Todo esto sin contar con la innovación que la saga Portal viene trayendo, siendo un first person shooter, juego de lógica y puzzle. ¡Recomiendo su compra! PD: No hay más que decir.

Однако Portal 2 до сих пор является одной из моих любимых игр! Помнится, еще давным давно купленная моим знакомым пиратка была установлена у меня. Я прошел Portal 2 за неделю, по тому времени это было быстро. Местами сложная, приходилось смотреть гайды, но все равно очень интересная игра. Когда же познакомился со Steam, я решил купить эту замечательную игру, и нисколечко не пожалел! Отличный режим кооператива прекрасно дополняет игру. Другой разговор можно завести про ГЛэ́ДОС с ее умопомрачительным юмором. В общем, игра шикарная, всем советую! (стандартная фраза на положительных рецензиях)
✰10/10
Amazing game.

Honestly, this game is my favorite out of the hundreds I've played. It has such a marvelous way of constantly keeping your attention through the 10 hour or so story mode. A delightful color scheme, incredible voice acting, a wonderful mechanic, and music that will always send chills down your spine.

I'm not going to review this forever, as I feel that would ruin the perfection of it. I just ask you to buy the game for yourself, and enjoy the time you have.

11/10
Like Portal 1.  But longer.  And more jokes about cake.

This is the equally innovative sequal to what could arguably be called one of the most innovative games of all time.   Being of such pedigree sets an extremely high standard for what one would expect from the game, and it still does not disappoint.

In addition to having just as fun puzzle-based gameplay as the orriginal it provides incredible atmosphere, with incredible backstory.   After playing Portal I would have never thought I could feel sorry for GLaDOS while still feeling angry at her, but this game proves me wrong.   The backstory of Aperature Science is as tragic as it is whimsical.  The major characters of Wheatly and GLaDOS are far more deeply developed than I could ever immagine.

The environments are beyond amazing, with each region having unique looks ranging from well built high-tech testing facuilties that "test subjects" are put through like lab rats, to aging abandoned industrial facuilaties.  

The soundtrack is incredible and sets a the mood to scenes be it fear, curiousity, anger, whimsy, or downright insanity.

In addition to the one player and cooperative story modes there are time trials for added replayability.   This is a game perfectionists will love.


Furthermore, this game has continued to age gracefully since it's release, and looks good even by the latest standards.

I honestly can't say anything bad about this game, and almost anyone would like this game.   Even the 13 year old brat swearing like a sailor on X-Box live will find GLaDOS's attempts to belittle you and all the dark humor of Aperature Labs' history to be incredibly entertaining, so even they will likely enjoy the game so long as they get over the fact that you don't get to shoot deadly guns.

Awesome game like no other, makes you work your mind to beat it, a lot more innovative than Portal 1 and has many new fun elements that's makes it a wonderful experience even for people who don't like puzzle games like me, simply worth your time and money.

Note: don't play when you are feeling tired, you will be a lot less functioning and everything will seem a lot harder, rest them come back and the part where you were stuck will be easy, just like many other games.

This is one of my most favourite games, it has an amazing and in depth storyline. The easter eggs like the borealis one are amazing. The plot twists genuinely aren't expected, unlike most games where you know what will happen around every corner. I'm a huge fan of greek mythology so when I found the oracle turret, my mind was blown! Cave Johnson was definitely a great character to introduce and to help us find out more about Aperture. THE ENDING, I absolutely loved the ending!!

Portal 2 ist ein echt gutes Geschicklichkeits/Knobelspiel, welches alleine schon im storymodus über 150 Lvl bietet (glaub ich) 
Aber, was dieses Spiel so besonders und witzig macht, ist nicht unbedingt das Gameplay, auch wenn mir das auch sehr gefallen hat. 
Es ist die Wechselwirkung zwischen dieser atmosphärischen Endzeitstimmung und den Monologe/Dialoge zwischen den einzelnen Leveln, die einfach nur zum Dauergrinsen sind. 
Eigentlich kann ich das Spiel jedem empfehlen, der gerne mal lacht , und wer kann sich nicht dazu zählen?

Think the maps are too easy? Make your own! or play player created ones!

This is what all sequels should strive to be. It takes you back to a farmiliar environment, and turns it on its head. You recognize things, but seeing them as they truly are now that you know what has happened makes it all that much more creepy. It manages to delve into the history of Aperture science, showing you who GlaDOS was before all of this, creates a new character who is just as interesting, and a final climax that will just blow you away.

My favorite game of all time. I have played through the single player multiple times and it never gets old. Steam workshop allows me and my buddy to play a near infinite amout of co-op levels together. This game is the full package. Please do yourself a favor and buy it. The atmosphere this game creates along with the outstanding storytelling and superb graphics take this piece from just a game to a true legend. Neither this game nor its predisesor will likey ever be forgotten in the gaming world. Ever.

I almost never do game reviews on steam, nor do I take them very seriously, but this game is just so worth it that I wrote all of this, just to convince you, yes you, that this game is right for you. It is worth every penny you might pay for it. (but hopefully you catch it on sale anyway :)

Portal 2 is a very great game. The price of $21.99 is definately worth it. I really liked the Humour. The game is not so easy that you can complete it in a few hours, but it is also not so challenging that it takes months to complete. It also had the coolest ending cutscene of any game I have ever played. WARNING: SPOILER ALERT!!!!- Don't read until you have made it to chapter 6 in game. One of my favourite parts is when Wheatley turns evil and turns GLaDOS into a potato. It is very funny and unforgettable. The game also has amazing graphics. All in all, I rate 10/10

“Well done. Here are the test results: You are a horrible person. I’m serious, that’s what it says: “A horrible person.” We weren’t even testing for that. Don’t let that horrible-person thing discourage you. It’s just a data point. If it makes you feel any better, science has now validated your birth mother’s decision to abandon you on a doorstep.” – GLaDOS

In Portal 2, you (Chell) find yourself in a hotel room of sorts where you just woke up from hibernation. The story element and the humor from the characters you become involved with are truly what make the game great. I find the puzzle element to be simply a bonus.  I won’t give away what happens in Portal 2, you’ll have to find out for yourself. I will say however that GLaDOS does make a comeback and you are introduced to a humorous AI program named “Wheatley.”

The game is much, much longer than its predescesor…you’ll find yourself playing this game for at least a few hours. Some of the puzzles were tricky, especially the later ones that brought lasers and different kinds of slime into the mix. The new features and environments help keep the game fresh while the story unfolds to its final conclusion.

For those of you who enjoy teaming up with a friend, you’ll be happy to know that there is a Co-Op mode that allows two players to tackle puzzles together. The Co-Op mode was designed separately from the main game so the puzzles you and your partner will face are completely new and just as likely to leave you scratching your head. Each player gets a portal gun, meaning you can have up to four portals in the test chambers at once. Most puzzles are designed around this, making you both coordinate your portals and movements in order to advance to the next room.

Easy to recommend to anyone who enjoys puzzles and interacting with psychotic AIs.
Best game I have ever played!

I really loved playing Portal 2, and that is saying a lot, since I usually prefer to play open-world games. I find that many games use the narrow predefined path for lack of content and because it takes less effort to program to run coherently. Portal 2 however is a game that doesn't suffer from any of the problems, these games are usually afflicted by. Firstly, while it's story may be predefined, it's gameplay is still wide-open. You have to solve the puzzle to progress, but how you solve the puzzle is up to you. Secondly, it's story is simply amazing. It's very well written and voice-acted, funny times, sad at others, but always engaging. As the player you don't feel like you're just a viewer in a movie, you feel engaged. 
Aside from that, the game's mechanics and graphics, as well as soundFX are very well-refined. Solving test-chambers - at least to me - often walked the line of being challenging, right inbetween easy and frustrating. If you have trouble solving one, you don't have to go to guide, just take a step back and clear your head. Creating and using portals feels very natural, as do most of the other tools the game provides you with to solve puzzles, all of which are very well integrated into the game's graphics, that don't have to rely on any sort of HUD and still manages to convey everything relevant. The soundFX and music are integrated in a way that makes them appear very natural and cinematic at times, set to sound when executing certain steps to solve a puzzle, thus also working as small hints. 

Ultimately I highly recommend Portal 2, for any price really, thoug chance are, it will be on sale before too long.
